intro: Malcolmia orsiniana subsp. orsiniana, commonly known as the Persian carpet flower, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its showy, yellow flowers are typically borne in clusters and bloom in the summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
